defs.name: Column
defs.docs:
A representation of a table's column.
 Useful for styling and specifying constraints how big a column should be.

attributes.value: / A representation of a table's column.
/ Useful for styling and specifying constraints how big a column should be.
/ 1. Content padding for cells in this column
/ 2. Constraints on how wide this column shall be
/ 3. Default alignment for cells in this column
/ Columns are generated when adding rows or a header to a table.\
/ As a result columns can only be modified after the table is populated by some data.
/ let mut column = table.get_column_mut(1).expect("This should be column two");
/ // Set the max width for all cells of this column to 20 characters.
/ // Set the left padding to 5 spaces and the right padding to 1 space
/ // Align content in all cells of this column to the center of the cell.

defs.name: presets
defs.docs:
This module provides styling presets for tables.\
 Every preset has an example preview.

attributes.value: / This module provides styling presets for tables.\
/ Every preset has an example preview.

defs.name: ASCII_FULL
defs.docs: The default style for tables.

defs.name: ASCII_NO_BORDERS
defs.docs: Default style without any borders.

defs.name: ASCII_BORDERS_ONLY
defs.docs: Just like ASCII_FULL, but without vertical/horizontal middle lines.

attributes.value: / Just like ASCII_FULL, but without vertical/horizontal middle lines.

defs.name: ASCII_HORIZONTAL_BORDERS_ONLY
defs.docs: Just like ASCII_FULL, but without vertical/horizontal middle lines and no side borders.

attributes.value: / Just like ASCII_FULL, but without vertical/horizontal middle lines and no side borders.

defs.name: ASCII_MARKDOWN
defs.docs: Markdown like table styles.

defs.name: UTF8_FULL
defs.docs:
The UTF8 enabled version of the default style for tables.\
 Quite beautiful isn't it? It's drawn with UTF8's box drawing characters.

attributes.value: / The UTF8 enabled version of the default style for tables.\
/ Quite beautiful isn't it? It's drawn with UTF8's box drawing characters.

defs.name: UTF8_NO_BORDERS
defs.docs: Default UTF8 style, but without any borders.

attributes.value: / Default UTF8 style, but without any borders.

defs.name: UTF8_BORDERS_ONLY
defs.docs: Just like the UTF8 FULL version, but without vertical/horizontal middle lines.

attributes.value: / Just like the UTF8 FULL version, but without vertical/horizontal middle lines.

defs.name: UTF8_HORIZONTAL_BORDERS_ONLY
defs.docs: Only display vertical lines.

defs.name: NOTHING
defs.docs: Don't draw any borders

defs.name: modifiers
defs.docs:
Contains modifiers, that can be used to alter certain parts of a preset.\
 For instance, the [UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS](modifiers::UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS) replaces all corners with round UTF8 box corners.

attributes.value: / Contains modifiers, that can be used to alter certain parts of a preset.\
/ For instance, the [UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS](modifiers::UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS) replaces all corners with round UTF8 box corners.

defs.name: UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS
defs.docs:
A modifier, that when applied will convert the outer corners to round corners.
 ```text
 
  Hello  there 
 
  a      b     
 
  c      d     
 
 ```

attributes.value: / A modifier, that when applied will convert the outer corners to round corners.

defs.name: Disabled
defs.docs:
Don't do any content arrangement.\
 Tables with this mode might become wider than your output and look ugly.\
 Constraints on columns are still respected.

attributes.value: / Tables with this mode might become wider than your output and look ugly.\
/ Constraints on columns are still respected.

defs.name: Dynamic
defs.docs:
Dynamically determine the width of columns in regard to terminal width and content length.\
 With this mode, the content in cells will wrap dynamically to get the  the best column layout
 for the given content.\
 Constraints on columns are still respected.

attributes.value: / Dynamically determine the width of columns in regard to terminal width and content length.\
/ With this mode, the content in cells will wrap dynamically to get the  the best column layout
/ Constraints on columns are still respected.
/ **Warning:** If terminal width cannot be determined and no table_width is set via [Table::set_table_width](crate::table::Table::set_table_width),
/ this option won't work and [Disabled](ContentArrangement::Disabled) will be used as a fallback.

defs.name: ContentArrangement
defs.docs: Specify how comfy_table should arrange the content in your table.

attributes.value: / Specify how comfy_table should arrange the content in your table.

defs.name: TableComponent
defs.value:
pub enum TableComponent {
    LeftBorder,
    RightBorder,
    TopBorder,
    BottomBorder,
    LeftHeaderIntersection,
    HeaderLines,
    MiddleHeaderIntersections,
    RightHeaderIntersection,
    VerticalLines,
    HorizontalLines,
    MiddleIntersections,
    LeftBorderIntersections,
    RightBorderIntersections,
    TopBorderIntersections,
    BottomBorderIntersections,
    TopLeftCorner,
    TopRightCorner,
    BottomLeftCorner,
    BottomRightCorner,
}
defs.docs:
All configurable table components.
 A character can be assigned to each component via [Table::set_style](crate::table::Table::set_style).
 This is then used to draw character of the respective component to the commandline.

attributes.value: / A character can be assigned to each component via [Table::set_style](crate::table::Table::set_style).
/ This is then used to draw character of the respective component to the commandline.
/ I hope that most component names are self-explanatory. Just in case:
/ BorderIntersections are Intersections, where rows/columns lines meet outer borders.

defs.name: CellAlignment
defs.value: pub enum CellAlignment { Left, Right, Center, }
defs.docs: This can be set on [columns](crate::Column::set_cell_alignment) and [cells](crate::Cell::set_alignment).

attributes.value: / This can be set on [columns](crate::Column::set_cell_alignment) and [cells](crate::Cell::set_alignment).
/ Determines how content of cells should be aligned.

defs.name: Hidden
defs.docs: This will completely hide a column.

attributes.value: / This will completely hide a column.

defs.name: ContentWidth
defs.docs:
Force the column to be as long as it's content.
 Use with caution! This can easily break your table, if the column's content is overly long.

attributes.value: / Force the column to be as long as it's content.
/ Use with caution! This can easily break your table, if the column's content is overly long.

defs.name: MaxWidth
defs.docs: Specify a max amount of allowed characters per line for a column.

attributes.value: / Specify a max amount of allowed characters per line for a column.

defs.name: Percentage
defs.docs:
Set a fixed percentage in respect to table_width for this column.
 **Warning:** This option will be ignored, if the width cannot be determined!

defs.name: ColumnConstraint
defs.docs: Constraints can be added to [columns](crate::Column).

attributes.value: / They allow some control over the dynamic content arrangement process.

defs.name: Table
defs.docs:
This is the main interface for building a table.
 Each table consists of [Rows](Row), which in turn contain [Cells](crate::cell::Cell).

attributes.value: / This is the main interface for building a table.
/ Each table consists of [Rows](Row), which in turn contain [Cells](crate::cell::Cell).
/ There also exists a representation of a [Column].
/ Columns are automatically created when adding rows to a table.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Create a new table with default ASCII styling.

attributes.value: / Create a new table with default ASCII styling.

defs.name: trim_fmt
defs.docs:
This is an alternative `fmt` function, which simply removes any trailing whitespaces.
 Trailing whitespaces often occur, when using tables without a right border.

attributes.value: / This is an alternative `fmt` function, which simply removes any trailing whitespaces.
/ Trailing whitespaces often occur, when using tables without a right border.

defs.name: set_header
defs.value: pub fn set_header<T: ToRow>(&mut Self, T) -> &mut Self
defs.docs:
Set the header row of the table. This is usually the title of each column.\
 There'll be no header unless you explicitly set it with this function.

attributes.value: / Set the header row of the table. This is usually the title of each column.\
/ There'll be no header unless you explicitly set it with this function.

defs.name: add_row
defs.value: pub fn add_row<T: ToRow>(&mut Self, T) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Add a new row to the table.

attributes.value: / Add a new row to the table.

defs.name: set_table_width
defs.value: pub fn set_table_width(&mut Self, u16) -> &mut Self
defs.docs:
Enforce a max width that should be used in combination with [dynamic content arrangement](ContentArrangement::Dynamic).\
 This is usually not necessary, if you plan to output your table to a tty,
 since the terminal width can be automatically determined.

attributes.value: / Enforce a max width that should be used in combination with [dynamic content arrangement](ContentArrangement::Dynamic).\
/ This is usually not necessary, if you plan to output your table to a tty,
/ since the terminal width can be automatically determined.

defs.name: get_table_width
defs.docs: Get the expected width of the table.

attributes.value: / Get the expected width of the table.
/ This will be `Some(width)`, if the terminal width can be detected or if the table width is set via [set_table_width](Table::set_table_width).
/ If neither is not possible, `None` will be returned.\
/ This implies that both the [Dynamic](ContentArrangement::Dynamic) mode and the [Percentage](crate::style::ColumnConstraint::Percentage) constraint won't work.

defs.value: pub fn set_content_arrangement(&mut Self, ContentArrangement) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Specify how Comfy Table should arrange the content in your table.

attributes.value: / Specify how Comfy Table should arrange the content in your table.

defs.name: set_delimiter
defs.value: pub fn set_delimiter(&mut Self, char) -> &mut Self
defs.docs: Set the delimiter used to split text in all cells.

attributes.value: / Set the delimiter used to split text in all cells.
/ A custom delimiter on a cell in will overwrite the column's delimiter.\
/ The default is a simple space ` `.

defs.name: force_no_tty
defs.docs:
In case you are sure you don't want export tables to a tty or you experience
 problems with tty specific code, you can enforce a non_tty mode.

attributes.value: / In case you are sure you don't want export tables to a tty or you experience
/ problems with tty specific code, you can enforce a non_tty mode.
/ - table_width lookup from the current tty
/ - Styling and attributes on cells (unless you use [Table::enforce_styling])
/ you need to set the width of your desired table manually with [set_table_width](Table::set_table_width).

defs.name: is_tty
defs.docs: Returns whether the table will be handled as if it's printed to a tty.

attributes.value: / Returns whether the table will be handled as if it's printed to a tty.
/ Otherwise we try to determine, if we are on a tty.

defs.name: enforce_styling
defs.docs: Enforce terminal styling.

attributes.value: / Only useful if you forcefully disabled tty, but still want those fancy terminal styles.

defs.name: should_style
defs.docs:
Returns whether the content of this table should be styled with the current settings and
 environment.

attributes.value: / Returns whether the content of this table should be styled with the current settings and

defs.name: set_constraints
defs.value:
pub fn set_constraints<T: IntoIterator<Item = ColumnConstraint>>(&mut Self, T)
-> &mut Self
defs.docs: Convenience method to set a [ColumnConstraint] for all columns at once.

attributes.value: / Convenience method to set a [ColumnConstraint] for all columns at once.
/ Simply pass any iterable with ColumnConstraints.\
/ If more constraints are passed than there are columns, the superfluous constraints will be ignored.

defs.name: load_preset
defs.docs:
This function creates a TableStyle from a given preset string.\
 Preset strings can be found in `styling::presets::*`.

attributes.value: / This function creates a TableStyle from a given preset string.\
/ Preset strings can be found in `styling::presets::*`.
/ You can also write your own preset strings and use them with this function.
/ There's the convenience method [Table::current_style_as_preset], which prints you a preset
/ string from your current style configuration. \
/ The function expects the to-be-drawn characters to be in the same order as in the [TableComponent] enum.
/ If the string isn't long enough, the default [ASCII_FULL] style will be used for all remaining components.
/ If the string is too long, remaining charaacters will be simply ignored.

defs.name: current_style_as_preset
defs.docs: Returns the current style as a preset string.

attributes.value: / Returns the current style as a preset string.
/ A pure convenience method, so you're not force to fiddle with those preset strings yourself.

defs.name: apply_modifier
defs.docs: Modify a preset with a modifier string from [modifiers](crate::style::modifiers).

attributes.value: / Modify a preset with a modifier string from [modifiers](crate::style::modifiers).
/ For instance, the [UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS](crate::style::modifiers::UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS) modifies all corners to be round UTF8 box corners.

defs.name: set_style
defs.value: pub fn set_style(&mut Self, TableComponent, char) -> &mut Self
defs.docs:
Define the char that will be used to draw a specific component.\
 Look at [TableComponent] to see all stylable components

attributes.value: / Define the char that will be used to draw a specific component.\
/ Look at [TableComponent] to see all stylable components
/ If `None` is supplied, the element won't be displayed.\
/ In case of a e.g. *BorderIntersection a whitespace will be used as placeholder,
/ unless related borders and and corners are set to `None` as well.
/ For example, if `TopBorderIntersections` is `None` the first row would look like this:
/ If in addition `TopLeftCorner`,`TopBorder` and `TopRightCorner` would be `None` as well,
/ the first line wouldn't be displayed at all.
/ // Set all outer corners to round UTF8 corners
/ // This is basically the same as the UTF8_ROUND_CORNERS modifier

defs.name: get_style
defs.value: pub fn get_style(&mut Self, TableComponent) -> Option<char>

attributes.value: / Get a copy of the char that's currently used for drawing this component.

defs.name: remove_style
defs.value: pub fn remove_style(&mut Self, TableComponent) -> &mut Self
defs.docs:
Remove the style for a specific component of the table.\
 By default, a space will be used as a placeholder instead.\
 Though, if for instance all components of the left border are removed, the left border won't be displayed.

attributes.value: / Remove the style for a specific component of the table.\
/ By default, a space will be used as a placeholder instead.\
/ Though, if for instance all components of the left border are removed, the left border won't be displayed.

defs.name: column_max_content_widths
defs.docs:
Return a vector representing the maximum amount of characters in any line of this column.\
 This is mostly needed for internal testing and formatting, but can be interesting
 if you want to see the widths of the longest lines for each column.

attributes.value: / Return a vector representing the maximum amount of characters in any line of this column.\
/ This is mostly needed for internal testing and formatting, but can be interesting
/ if you want to see the widths of the longest lines for each column.
